guild.description:
For memes and shitposting about everything that happens in our beloved "Official Ruqqus Discord"
 
---

## Posting Rules


Rule 1: 

This guild is for shitposting about people/events in the Ruqqus Discord server. Any post that is not related to this will be kicked to +general. If you need help regarding the discord server, +askruqqus, +general, or +hub would gladly accept your questions.


Rule 2:

No spamming. Spamming would be considered any of the following:

* Same-format posting within a day

* Same-content posting within a day (Same content, different format)


Spammed posts will get kicked and repeated offenses results in being exiled.


Rule 3: 

No reposts: reposts are cringe. Any reposts will be kicked.

post.body: Sorry for the album link but it’s multiple images, thought I would share
post.body_html: Sorry for the album link but it’s multiple images, thought I would share
post.title: What lead to Murmur’s Ban

body:
He'll always have twitter for kid-touching "discussion".

Sure, it's be nice to see exactly what Murmur was doing/saying, but Cap isn't unreasonable, nor is he tyrannical.

Discord has taken a HARD left-turn in the past 8-ish months and we'd all be fools not to suspect they A: are aware of and hate Ruqqus and B: operating under that assumption, we must assume that they are  "looking for a reason", which Cap intimated in one of his warnings.

Under those conditions, he took the necessary and correct steps.

Now... should Ruqqus be associated with Discord? That's an entirely different subject.

I don't use the Discord for Ruqqus and never intend to, so my input matters not at all, but I believe that Ruqqus should not have a presence on a platform that's clearly making a dash for the "Big Tech Socialist Utopia".

That being said, skeeving on minors is bullshit, illegal behavior that wouldn't be tolerated here anymore than it would on Discord, so that is not a factor in my opinion RE: Ruqqies and Discord shouldn't mix.
body_html:
He'll always have twitter for kid-touching "discussion".

Sure, it's be nice to see exactly what Murmur was doing/saying, but Cap isn't unreasonable, nor is he tyrannical.

Discord has taken a HARD left-turn in the past 8-ish months and we'd all be fools not to suspect they A: are aware of and hate Ruqqus and B: operating under that assumption, we must assume that they are "looking for a reason", which Cap intimated in one of his warnings.

Under those conditions, he took the necessary and correct steps.

Now... should Ruqqus be associated with Discord? That's an entirely different subject.

I don't use the Discord for Ruqqus and never intend to, so my input matters not at all, but I believe that Ruqqus should not have a presence on a platform that's clearly making a dash for the "Big Tech Socialist Utopia".

That being said, skeeving on minors is bullshit, illegal behavior that wouldn't be tolerated here anymore than it would on Discord, so that is not a factor in my opinion RE: Ruqqies and Discord shouldn't mix.

post.title: What lead to Murmur’s Ban

body:
Is it martyrdom if you hang yourself on the cross? I don't believe that it is.

Persecution? Not at all. Murmur was engaging in behavior that is both illegal and harmful to others.

He wasn't banned because he was talking about fucking a sock puppet. He was talking about activities involving porking a human that is incapable of consent, according to the laws of the vast majority of the world's nations.

Attempting to normalize pedophilia should be listed as a crime against humanity.
body_html:
Is it martyrdom if you hang yourself on the cross? I don't believe that it is.

Persecution? Not at all. Murmur was engaging in behavior that is both illegal and harmful to others.

He wasn't banned because he was talking about fucking a sock puppet. He was talking about activities involving porking a human that is incapable of consent, according to the laws of the vast majority of the world's nations.

Attempting to normalize pedophilia should be listed as a crime against humanity.

body:
The saddest thing was the last message sent by that random before Murmur was banned.
“Wait wat how do I join this MC server from Xbox.”
I feel so bad for them. They’re going to realize the harsh truth that you can’t play on Java servers from Bedrock.

Also @Drakus_ there’s a screenshot stitching app for iPhone called Tailor. If you’re on Android, there’s Longshot.
body_html:
The saddest thing was the last message sent by that random before Murmur was banned. “Wait wat how do I join this MC server from Xbox.” I feel so bad for them. They’re going to realize the harsh truth that you can’t play on Java servers from Bedrock.

Also @Drakus_ there’s a screenshot stitching app for iPhone called Tailor. If you’re on Android, there’s Longshot.

post.title: What lead to Murmur’s Ban

author.bio:
Ruqqus cofounder and lead backend developer.

https://github.com/captainmeta4
author.bio_html:
Ruqqus cofounder and lead backend developer.

https://github.com/captainmeta4

body:
He'd been repeatedly promoting lolicon and shoticon, which are highly sexualized artwork of young girls and boys, respectively. 

This violates Ruqqus ToS about "no sexualizing minors including fictitious content" (or, it would violate it if it were on Ruqqus), and also violates our Discord rule about "don't do anything that could get the discord server banned."

Through numerous warnings, he chose to play the noble martyr rather than clean up his act. At that point it was clear he had no intention of *not* endangering the Ruqqus discord server.

He also had a MLP profile pic, which should be a bannable offense on its own. 

Should Ruqqus have an official discord server? Personally I'd say no, and I would like to eventually have a Ruqqus chat system to replace it. For now though, it's needed as a place to informally discuss the platform, coordinate with testers, and deal with urgent issues.
body_html:
He'd been repeatedly promoting lolicon and shoticon, which are highly sexualized artwork of young girls and boys, respectively.

This violates Ruqqus ToS about "no sexualizing minors including fictitious content" (or, it would violate it if it were on Ruqqus), and also violates our Discord rule about "don't do anything that could get the discord server banned."

Through numerous warnings, he chose to play the noble martyr rather than clean up his act. At that point it was clear he had no intention of not endangering the Ruqqus discord server.

He also had a MLP profile pic, which should be a bannable offense on its own.

Should Ruqqus have an official discord server? Personally I'd say no, and I would like to eventually have a Ruqqus chat system to replace it. For now though, it's needed as a place to informally discuss the platform, coordinate with testers, and deal with urgent issues.

author.bio_html:
Life • Liberty • Property

GM of +VoteWithYourWallet, +GuildOfTheDay, +FirearmClassifieds, +TradeSecrets, +Getaways, & +Tools

body:
I definitely understand why he was banned on discord and why he’d be banned here given the ToS.  I guess the bigger question is, since we promote & uphold the first amendment, would that not include that artwork?  

I personally think it’s degenerate, however if it’s legal under US law should it not be legal here? Or is the thought that with how good computer aided art is getting that you eventually won’t be able to tell the difference between what’s real & what’s not.

Im not trying to attack you guys or what you’ve done; more so just wanting to understand the rationale behind it.
body_html:
I definitely understand why he was banned on discord and why he’d be banned here given the ToS. I guess the bigger question is, since we promote & uphold the first amendment, would that not include that artwork?

I personally think it’s degenerate, however if it’s legal under US law should it not be legal here? Or is the thought that with how good computer aided art is getting that you eventually won’t be able to tell the difference between what’s real & what’s not.

Im not trying to attack you guys or what you’ve done; more so just wanting to understand the rationale behind it.

post.title: What lead to Murmur’s Ban

author.bio:
Ruqqus cofounder and lead backend developer.

https://github.com/captainmeta4
author.bio_html:
Ruqqus cofounder and lead backend developer.

https://github.com/captainmeta4

body:
There are a few narrowly defined categories of speech that are arguably covered by the first amendment but not allowed on Ruqqus. Fictional sexualized depictions of minors is one of those. We do not have the time or resources to sort out what may or may not be connected to actual child abuse.

The other types of speech in the "1A protected but not allowed on Ruqqus" category are (off the top of my head) doxxing, spam, solicitation of personal information, digitally malicious content if you view code as speech, and admin impersonation.
body_html:
There are a few narrowly defined categories of speech that are arguably covered by the first amendment but not allowed on Ruqqus. Fictional sexualized depictions of minors is one of those. We do not have the time or resources to sort out what may or may not be connected to actual child abuse.

The other types of speech in the "1A protected but not allowed on Ruqqus" category are (off the top of my head) doxxing, spam, solicitation of personal information, digitally malicious content if you view code as speech, and admin impersonation.

No reposts: reposts are cringe. Any reposts will be kicked.

parent.body:
I definitely understand why he was banned on discord and why he’d be banned here given the ToS.  I guess the bigger question is, since we promote & uphold the first amendment, would that not include that artwork?  

I personally think it’s degenerate, however if it’s legal under US law should it not be legal here? Or is the thought that with how good computer aided art is getting that you eventually won’t be able to tell the difference between what’s real & what’s not.

Im not trying to attack you guys or what you’ve done; more so just wanting to understand the rationale behind it.
parent.body_html:
I definitely understand why he was banned on discord and why he’d be banned here given the ToS. I guess the bigger question is, since we promote & uphold the first amendment, would that not include that artwork?

I personally think it’s degenerate, however if it’s legal under US law should it not be legal here? Or is the thought that with how good computer aided art is getting that you eventually won’t be able to tell the difference between what’s real & what’s not.

Im not trying to attack you guys or what you’ve done; more so just wanting to understand the rationale behind it.

body:
Thanks for the detailed response. I understand your reasoning & maybe in time (with the money to back it) there will be a way for that area of free speech to be opened up. Although these particular points don’t effect me personally, I am a big proponent of unlimited free speech & would support a decision to eventually roll back those rules (so long as it’s within the scope of the laws of the US). 

Anyway, thanks for making a great platform!
body_html:
Thanks for the detailed response. I understand your reasoning & maybe in time (with the money to back it) there will be a way for that area of free speech to be opened up. Although these particular points don’t effect me personally, I am a big proponent of unlimited free speech & would support a decision to eventually roll back those rules (so long as it’s within the scope of the laws of the US).

Anyway, thanks for making a great platform!

parent.body:
There are a few narrowly defined categories of speech that are arguably covered by the first amendment but not allowed on Ruqqus. Fictional sexualized depictions of minors is one of those. We do not have the time or resources to sort out what may or may not be connected to actual child abuse.

The other types of speech in the "1A protected but not allowed on Ruqqus" category are (off the top of my head) doxxing, spam, solicitation of personal information, digitally malicious content if you view code as speech, and admin impersonation.
parent.body_html:
There are a few narrowly defined categories of speech that are arguably covered by the first amendment but not allowed on Ruqqus. Fictional sexualized depictions of minors is one of those. We do not have the time or resources to sort out what may or may not be connected to actual child abuse.

The other types of speech in the "1A protected but not allowed on Ruqqus" category are (off the top of my head) doxxing, spam, solicitation of personal information, digitally malicious content if you view code as speech, and admin impersonation.

body: I'm supposed to be taking a break from Ruqqus right now, but I wanted to say I appreciate your plans to free Ruqqus from the totalitarian regime that is Discord. It will do more good than you think in the end. I suppose I misinterpreted your previous comments in light of what I'd seen on reddit, and that was my mistake, so sorry if I offended you. I still don't agree with everything but I'll try not to make a huge deal out of it in the future. Keep up the good work! :)

It will do more good than you think in the end. I suppose I misinterpreted your previous comments in light of what I'd seen on reddit, and that was my mistake, so sorry if I offended you. I still don't agree with everything but I'll try not to make a huge deal out of it in the future. Keep up the good work! :)

parent.body:
He'd been repeatedly promoting lolicon and shoticon, which are highly sexualized artwork of young girls and boys, respectively. 

This violates Ruqqus ToS about "no sexualizing minors including fictitious content" (or, it would violate it if it were on Ruqqus), and also violates our Discord rule about "don't do anything that could get the discord server banned."

Through numerous warnings, he chose to play the noble martyr rather than clean up his act. At that point it was clear he had no intention of *not* endangering the Ruqqus discord server.

He also had a MLP profile pic, which should be a bannable offense on its own. 

Should Ruqqus have an official discord server? Personally I'd say no, and I would like to eventually have a Ruqqus chat system to replace it. For now though, it's needed as a place to informally discuss the platform, coordinate with testers, and deal with urgent issues.
parent.body_html:
He'd been repeatedly promoting lolicon and shoticon, which are highly sexualized artwork of young girls and boys, respectively.

This violates Ruqqus ToS about "no sexualizing minors including fictitious content" (or, it would violate it if it were on Ruqqus), and also violates our Discord rule about "don't do anything that could get the discord server banned."

Through numerous warnings, he chose to play the noble martyr rather than clean up his act. At that point it was clear he had no intention of not endangering the Ruqqus discord server.

He also had a MLP profile pic, which should be a bannable offense on its own.

Should Ruqqus have an official discord server? Personally I'd say no, and I would like to eventually have a Ruqqus chat system to replace it. For now though, it's needed as a place to informally discuss the platform, coordinate with testers, and deal with urgent issues.
